edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model

Class TrailList

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model.TrailList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tabular, java.util.Observer

    public class TrailList
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.util.Observer, Tabular
    A TrailList maintains a collection of Trails in the system, providing functionality adding and removing trails, notifying Trails when a Park's snowChange field is updated, and returning display arrays for the Trails in a Park. TrailList has a 1-1 correspondence with the Park class, as every list of Trails must have a Park in which they're located. TrailList is both an Observer and an Observable type. The TrailList's Park and Trails are observed, and GetOutdoorsManager observers TrailList.
    Author:
    demills

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrailList

        public TrailList(Park park)
        Constructs a TraiList, taking the Park in which they are located as a parameter. The fields are initialized, with the TrailList's ID set to the Park's ID. Observers are then notified.
        Parameters:
        park - the Park in which the Trails belong.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Park parameter is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getParkName

        public java.lang.String getParkName()
        Returns the name of the TrailList's Park.
        Returns:
        returns the TrailList's Park's name.

      • addTrail

        public boolean addTrail(java.lang.String name,
                        SortedArrayList<Activity> activities,
                        boolean maintenance,
                        double snow,
                        double distance,
                        Difficulty difficulty)
        Adds a new Trail to the TrailList, taking all parameters required for creating a Trail, minus the Trail's ID, which is generated as the Park's ID, appended by "-numTrails". For example the second Trail added to a list with Park ID, "park-5", would be given the ID, "park-5-1".
        Parameters:
        name - the Trail's name
        activities - a list of Activities permitted on the Trail.
        maintenance - whether the Trail is closed for maintenance; true if so.
        snow - the current depth of snow on the trail.
        distance - the length of the Trail.
        difficulty - the Difficulty value associated with a Trail.
        Returns:
        true if the Trail addition was succesful; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a Trail couldn't be constructed from the parameters.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Returns whether an Object equals this TrailList. An Object is considered equal if it is a TrailList with identically named Parks.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • get2DArray

        public java.lang.Object[][] get2DArray()
        Returns a 2D array of Objects where each row represents a Trail in the list. The columns of each row are the fields of a Trail as such: 0 = String - Trail ID 1 = String - Trail name 2 = boolean - "closedForMaintenance" 3 = double - depth of snow on Trail. 4 = double - length of trail ("distance") 5 = Difficulty - difficulty of Trail 6 = SortedArrayList - Activities permitted on Trail.
        Specified by:
        get2DArray in interface Tabular
        Returns:
        returns a 2D array representing the Trails in the list.

      • get2DArray

        public java.lang.Object[][] get2DArray(Activity activity)
        Returns a 2D array of Objects where each row represents a Trail in the list that permits and is open for the specified Activity. The columns of each row are the fields of a Trail as such: 0 = String - Trail ID 1 = String - Trail name 2 = boolean - "closedForMaintenance" 3 = double - depth of snow on Trail. 4 = double - length of trail ("distance") 5 = Difficulty - difficulty of Trail 6 = SortedArrayList - Activities permitted on Trail.
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity by which to filter the TrailList.
        Returns:
        returns a 2D array representing the Trails in the list that allow the specified Activity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter is null.

      • get2DArrayNoMaintenance

        public java.lang.Object[][] get2DArrayNoMaintenance()
        Returns a 2D array of Objects where each row represents a Trail in the list that is not closed for maintenance. The columns of each row are the fields of a Trail as such: 0 = String - Trail ID 1 = String - Trail name 2 = boolean - "closedForMaintenance" 3 = double - depth of snow on Trail. 4 = double - length of trail ("distance") 5 = Difficulty - difficulty of Trail 6 = SortedArrayList - Activities permitted on Trail.
        Returns:
        returns a 2D array representing the Trails not closed for maintenance.

      • indexOfID

        public int indexOfID(java.lang.String trailID)
        Returns the index of the Trail in the list matching the specified Trail ID. If no such Trail exists, -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        trailID - ID of the Trail to search for.
        Returns:
        returns the index of the specified Trail; -1 if it doesn't exist.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable obs,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        If one of TrailList's Observed objects, Trail or Park, is updated, this method is called. For an updated Trail, TrailList's Observer, GetOutdoorsManager, is notified if the passed Observable Trail ("obs") is contained in the list. For an updated Park (i.e. one with a fresh snowfall or melt), each Trail in this TrailList is passed the latest Park's "snowChange" value. Then TrailList's Observer, GetOutdoorsManager, is notified of the change.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        obs - the Observable Object, either a Park or Trail.
        arg - the Observer of this TrailList
